content: There’s 2 important points that are missed here. There is an outstanding definition of design(ing) that satisfies all the requirements without all of the disciplinary boundary-making bullshit. It’s Herbert Simon’s definition: “Everyone designs who devise courses of action aimed at changing existing situations into preferred ones.”There’s a difference between a person who happens to design — something everyone does sooner or later — and someone who is a (professional) designer. The difference is that the professional has training, may even have some kind of certification, and can and does reflect on their designerly activities; the other kind lacks the training/certification and doesn’t necessarily recognize that they’ve designed when they do it.
